intro: Spirotheca, commonly known as the spirotheca plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are typically small and clustered in inflorescences, often with five petals. The genus includes several species, some of which are cultivated for their ornamental value. Spirotheca plants are native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
